definition: to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Over the following three weeks, I sat in daily meditation for only five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 在接下来的三周，我每日坐禅仅5分钟。

sentences.english: Zazen is meticulous work and details are important.
sentences.chinese: 坐禅需要一丝不苟，细节是关键。

sentences.english: It was originally drunk before meditation to help with mental awareness and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 起初抹茶是在坐禅前饮用的，来帮助清醒头脑。

sentences.english: You need to be as comfortable as possible during zazen so that you can sit without moving.
sentences.chinese: 坐禅的时候要坐得舒服，这样才可以坐得久而不挪位。

sentences.english: Researchers discovered that the Zen meditators did have an edge over the control group.
sentences.chinese: 研究者发现，坐禅者确实比对照组有优势。

sentences.english: If you're new to meditation, remember that it's a practice.
sentences.chinese: 如果你刚开始坐禅，记住这是一种练习。

definition: to practice Chan Buddhist meditation/to practice Zen meditation/to sit in meditation
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
to pray to Buddha/to chant the names of Buddha
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
